channel.title: Run.bat for client Broken?
channel.description:
[size=36pt]ok when i run my client i get this:[/size]
[size=14pt]Running AD Client Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: EGUI at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:303) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:316) Could not find the main class: EGUI. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .[/size]

item.title: Run.bat for client Broken?
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

Do this i fixed earlier

@echo off
title WHATEVAUWANT
java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar EGUI
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Run.bat for client Broken?
item.dc:creator: @Raams Raams
item.description:
@Raams wrote:

The run.bat isn’t broken, do you not understand what its saying?
Basically the batch file can’t find the main class; EGUI.class.

So either you need to compile, tell the batch to go to the correct directory or the file is simpily missing.

Read full topic
